body:
**Describe the bug**

Assignment between two memoryview slices works (`__pyx_memoryview_copy_contents`).
Assignment of a memoryview slice from a python object doesn't work (and produces a slightly confusing error message because it tries to convert the right-hand side to a scalar number).
This does seem inconsistent.

(This is essentially a more minimal version of the issue experienced in https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3897)

**To Reproduce**
Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
import numpy as np

def test():
    cdef double[:] lhs = np.ones((10,))
    cdef double[:] rhs_mview = np.zeros((10,))
    lhs[:] = rhs_mview[:] # works
    lhs[:] = 0.0 # works
    cdef object one = 1
    lhs[:] = one # works
    cdef object rhs_obj = rhs_mview
    lhs[:] = rhs_obj  # fails - TypeError: must be real number, not mviewtuple._memoryviewslice
```

**Expected behavior**

Either `rhs_obj` should be copied into the slice, or possibly a more specific error message to help guide users to type the right-hand side.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux (but I doubt it matters)
 - Python version: 3.8.5
 - Cython version: current master + 0.29.21
title: [BUG] Memoryview slice assignment from object doesn't work
